result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant IVAN BRITO MANCINAS in court with attorney Vicki C. Jobling.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation for DAA--9 months.    The bond is lifted and no longer in effect.
Tickler Review Date scheduled for March 15, 2023 at 07:45 am.

Defendant IVAN BRITO MANCINAS in court with attorney Vicki C. Jobling.  Defendant IVAN BRITO MANCINAS in custody WCJ.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  IVAN BRITO MANCINAS appeared by video means with Attorney.  24/7 violation.  State requestions reinstatement of bond.  Court reinstates signature bond.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.

Defendant IVAN BRITO MANCINAS in court with attorney Vicki C. Jobling.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waive reading. Court amends bond to include 24/7 drug. Court appoints attorney.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:52 AM Defendant IVAN BRITO MANCINAS in court with attorney Vicki C. Jobling.  Eric Sparr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 8:54.  Arraignment scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
